column3:
Bailey and her friend Kara were bored one Saturday.  It was a hot summer day.  They didn't
ewlinewant to stay inside any longer but they didn't know what to do.  They were tired of
ewlinewatching TV inside.  Suddenly, Kara had an idea.  She said, "Bailey, we could make some
ewlinemoney."  "How?," asked Bailey.  "Well, it is hot outside," said Kara. "People are thirsty
ewlineout there.  We could make money by making some lemonade and iced tea and have people pay
ewlinefor it."  "That is a great idea," answered Bailey, "let's do it!" Kara had made some iced
ewlinetea with her mom earlier that day.  She asked her mom permission to use it.  Her mom said
ewlineyes.  She and Kara made two pitchers of lemonade.  They got a cooler full of ice and made
ewlinea sign so people knew what was for sale.  Kara's mom helped them get a table and chairs
ewlineand set up out on the corner in their neighborhood.  It was so hot out that people who saw
ewlinetheir stand came to buy drinks right away. Their first visitors to their stand were their
ewlinefriends, Abby and Molly.  In a half hour, they had to close their stand. They were all
ewlineout of lemonade and iced tea.  They had made a lot of money. They split the money and each
ewlinegot ten dollars.  It was a great day.
column4: one: Which two friends were bored one Saturday?
column9: one: How many pitchers of lemonade did they make?
column14: multiple: Who help them set up their stand?
column19: multiple: How long was their stand open?
